pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:0.5: 7. The training rule on lowered eyes
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking here and there while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.3.1: “‘I will walk with lowered eyes in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.4: One should lower one’s eyes while walking in an inhabited area, looking of a plow’s length ahead.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, looks here and there while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk7:1.14: The seventh training rule is finished.
